hook.text: Wetlands filter water, absorb floods, and shelter wildlife. The US has lost over half of its original wetlands.

buildup.text: Section 404 of the Clean Water Act requires permits to fill or dredge wetlands connected to navigable waters.

discovery.text: The Army Corps of Engineers issues permits. The EPA can veto them if the environmental damage is too severe.

twist.text: Sackett v. EPA (2023) removed protections for wetlands not directly connected to navigable watersâ€”millions of acres.

climax.text: States are now the last line of defense. Some are passing their own wetland laws to fill the federal gap.

punchline.text: Wetlands are nature's infrastructure. Losing them costs more than saving them.

quiz.question: What did Sackett v. EPA do to wetland protections?
options: Removed protections for wetlands not directly connected to navigable waters
